title: Instant Pot Pot Roast with Potatoes and Carrots

Ingredients.11: 1 teaspoon Dash freshly ground black pepper

Directions.1: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot) and select Saute function. Pour in 2 tablespoons oil. Add roast to hot oil and cook until browned all over, 4 to 5 minutes per side. Add broth.

Directions.2: Combine remaining oil, potatoes, carrots, onion, and soup mix in a resealable plastic bag. Seal and shake to coat evenly. Pour mixture into the pressure cooker and spread out evenly.

Directions.3: Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 60 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.

Directions.4: Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid.

Directions.5: Remove roast from pot and place on a serving platter, leaving drippings in the pot.

Directions.6: Select Saute function and bring drippings to a boil. Combine water and cornstarch in a bowl and add to drippings. Cook, stirring frequently, until slightly thickened, 2 to 3 minutes. Season gravy with garlic salt and pepper.

Directions.7: Slice roast and serve with vegetables and gravy.
